meanings.definition: A musical term referring to an instrumental or vocal part that is essential to a piece of music.
meanings.sent1: The obbligato played by the violin added depth to the symphony.
meanings.sent2: The pianist performed the obbligato beautifully during the concert.
meanings.sent3: The obbligato by the flute made the audience tap their feet in rhythm.
meanings.sent4: Her voice soared like an obbligato through the entire composition.
meanings.sent5: The obbligato by the cello resonated in the hall, captivating everyone.

meanings.sent1: Wearing a helmet is obbligato when riding a bike for safety.
meanings.sent2: The completion of the assignment on time was obbligato for a good grade.
meanings.sent3: His obbligato presence at the meeting ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent4: The obbligato attendance of all team members was crucial for success.
meanings.sent5: Following the rules is obbligato to maintain order in the classroom.
